column1: Ooh!... I can read it on your face. You're going to love it here in Pelican Town.
column2: 哦哦！……從你的表情我看得出來，你已經開始喜歡上鵜鶘鎮這裡了。

column1: If you're ever looking for something to do in the evening, stop by the saloon. That's where I work!
column2: 你要是晚上想找事情做的話可以去酒吧看看，我在那裡工作哦！

column1: Oh, I like this place! It's full of parrots!
column2: 啊，這個地方真不錯！好多鸚鵡！

column1: Ah... my lungs feel perfect.
column2: 啊……呼吸好舒暢。

column1: Can you feel it? The ocean has a profound healing energy.
column2: 你能感覺到嗎？海洋有著深厚的治癒能量。

column1: Are you having fun, @? You need to remember to take breaks now and then too!
column2: @，你玩得開心嗎？累了的話，記得休息一下！

column1: It's nice to be on this side of the bar for once!
column2: 能在酒吧當一次顧客真是奇妙！

column1: If you open your heart to the sun, you can feel a loving energy inside of you.
column2: 如果你向太陽敞開心扉，就能在體內感受到愛的能量。

column1: Emily is lost in the music.
column2: 艾米麗沉醉在音樂裡。

column1: I'm very sorry... but I've already agreed to dance with someone else.
column2: 很抱歉……我已經答應與別人共舞了。

column1: @... You broke my heart... I just can't talk to you anymore.
column2: @……你讓我心都碎了……我不能再和你說話了。

column1: Please, let me try to heal...
column2: 求求你，我要平靜一下……

column1: B...But I thought we had a special bond... *sniff*
column2: 但……但是我以為我們之間有特殊的牽絆……（抽鼻子）

column1: Oh, that's beautiful... I have a friend who would love that! But she lives far from here...
column2: 啊，真漂亮……我有個朋友，她一定會喜歡的！但她住得離這裡很遠……

column1: @... I'm ready to give you a second chance. I still have faith that there's a good person inside of you.
column2: @……我準備給你第二次機會。我仍然相信你的內在是個好人。

column1: Have I told you Haley and I are sisters? Strange, isn't it?
column2: 我和海莉是姐妹，這事我跟你說過嗎？是不是很奇怪？

column1: I have a secret hobby, but I won't say any more.
column2: 我有一個不為人知的愛好，但我不會說。

column1: Maybe I'll show you some day.
column2: 也許有一天我會告訴你。

column1: This world is full of spirits and magic... Some don't believe me, but I know it's true.
column2: 這個世界充斥著幽靈與魔法……有些人不相信我，但我知道這是真的。

column1: I can see it in your eyes... you believe in the other world, like me.
column2: 我從你眼睛裡可以看出來……你相信異世界的存在，就像我一樣。

column1: I wish Haley would get a job or at least contribute to cooking and cleaning.
column2: 我希望海莉可以找份工作，或者至少可以做做飯，打掃打掃房間。

column1: I think she's hoping to marry someone rich.
column2: 我覺得她想嫁給有錢人。

column1: I have to say, now that Haley's gone I've had a much easier time keeping things in order.
column2: 不得不說，自從海莉走後，我的生活更井井有序了。

column1: There's good people in this town who just can't seem to find happiness. It makes me sad.
column2: 這個小鎮有些人雖然很善良，但還是找不到屬於自己的幸福。這讓我傷心。

column1: Working in the saloon, I hear first-hand about everyone's problems.
column2: 由於我在酒吧工作，所以也能聽到各種酸甜苦辣，人間冷暖。

column1: I work part-time at Gus' saloon. It pays the bills.
column2: 我在格斯的酒吧兼職。賺的錢能解決好多問題呢。

column1: I'm just working at Gus' to make ends meet... but my real passion is tailoring.
column2: 我是為了維生才在格斯的酒吧工作……我真正的夢想是當裁縫師。

column1: I made these clothes from scratch, see?
column2: 你看，這些衣服都是我親手縫的哦。

column1: Oh, hi... It's nice of you to visit me like this.
column2: 噢，嗨……很高興你來看我。

column1: You know, @... I think the future looks bright for both of us.
column2: @……我認為我們的未來都很光明。

column1: I've heard rumors of rare and powerful magic rings, forged long ago by forgotten civilizations. I'm not sure if it's true or just a fairy tale.
column2: 我聽說過一些關於稀世魔戒的傳言。據說這些戒指由失落的文明所打造。我也不知道是不是真的。

column1: You catch fish? I just hope you treat the poor things humanely.
column2: 你去捕魚啊？我只是希望你能善待那些可憐的小傢伙。

column1: Every critter deserves our respect, even the slimy ones.
column2: 就算是這些黏黏的生物，我們也要心懷敬意。

column1: Have faith... every day you're taking one more step on the path of your destiny.
column2: 相信自己……每一天，你都向目標邁進了一步。

column1: Hi, @.
column2: @，你好啊。

column1: I always knew we'd become close like this...
column2: 我就知道我們會成為親密無間的朋友……

column1: I hope you're farming in a sustainable way. The valley's ecosystem is fragile!
column2: 我希望你可以用永續的方法來耕作。星露谷的生態系統可是很脆弱的！

column1: How do I know? I have a strong gut-feeling!
column2: 你問我怎麼知道的？我的直覺可是很強的！

column1: Sometimes the flowers speak to me... each one has a different story to tell!
column2: 有時候，花會跟我說話……每一朵都在訴說著不同的故事！

column1: Ah, spring. The season of pastels. I actually prefer jewel tones, myself.
column2: 春天啊，繽紛的季節。個人來講我很喜歡寶石色調的。

column1: Oh, excuse me! I was mumbling about fashion again, wasn't I?
column2: 哦，抱歉！我是不是又開始嘀咕關於流行的東西了？

column1: I like making my own clothes, but it's not easy to get cloth.
column2: 我喜歡自己做衣服，可是要弄到布料不是很容易。

column1: And it's such a long trip to the city.
column2: 要走好遠才能走到城市啊。

column1: Do you ever think about the texture of fabric, @? Each texture has a distinct personality... feel my dress... see?
column2: @，你有沒有想過布料的材質？每種材質都有不同的個性……摸摸我的裙子……感覺到了嗎？

column1: Hi @!
Do you raise sheep in your barn? You can turn their wool into beautiful bolts of cloth!
column2: 你有沒有養綿羊啊？牠們的毛可以織成非常漂亮的布料！

column1: You'll need a loom, though. You can make them yourself if you know the crafting recipe.
column2: 不過，你需要一臺織布機。如果你知道怎麼做的話可以自己做一個。

column1: This house was left in our care by my parents. They've been traveling the world for the last two years.
column2: 這兩年我爸媽跑去環遊世界了，把房子交給我們顧。

column1: We have no idea when they'll be back.
column2: 我們也不知道他們什麼時候會回來。

column1: I enjoy living here, though. It's a beautiful area and the town is nice.
column2: 不過我很喜歡在這裡生活。這裡很漂亮，小鎮也很棒。

column1: Thank you!
column2: 非常感謝！

column1: Um... Okay. Sorry you didn't like it. I guess those three years of practice were a complete waste...
column2: 呃……好吧。真是抱歉，原來你不喜歡啊。看來這三年來的練習都是在浪費時間……

column1: Did you really think so? That's exactly the effect I was shooting for!
column2: 你真的這麼想嗎？那正是我想達到的效果！

column1: I'm so glad you liked it.
column2: 我很高興你喜歡。

column1: Haley is a picky eater. It's so hard to cook for her.
column2: 幫海莉弄吃的真的很麻煩，她會挑食。

column1: Eating healthy is very important to me. I want to live a long and active life.
column2: 健康飲食是非常重要的。我希望能夠長壽且始終保持精力充沛。

column1: Haley and I get along much better now that she's moved out. I look forward to her visits!
column2: 海莉搬走之後，我們的關係就好多了。我現在很期待她能來看看我！

column1: Hello there, @.
column2: 你好啊，@。

column1: I feel lazy today.
column2: 我今天感覺一動都不想動。

column1: I feel bad for Linus. People judge him, but he's just living a different lifestyle.
column2: 萊納斯真是可憐。人們總對他懷有偏見，但他只是生活方式和別人不一樣而已。

column1: I wish everyone could learn to be accepting of others.
column2: 我希望大家都能學會接受別人。

column1: Hi, @! We've become decent friends, haven't we?
column2: 嗨，@！我們已經是好朋友了，對不對？

column1: That's fine with me. You're a cool guy.
column2: 我覺得很好。你人很好。

column1: I'm glad.
column2: 我很高興。

column1: Hi, @! We've become decent friends, haven't we?
column2: @你好！我們已經是好朋友了吧？

column1: This may sound weird, but I've always been certain this would happen.
column2: 雖然感覺有點怪怪的，但我一直相信我們能成為好朋友。

column1: It doesn't rain much in summer, does it?
column2: 夏天不怎麼下雨對吧？

column1: That just means more watering work for you, huh?
column2: 對你來說可意味著要澆更多的水了，是不是？

column1: Or do you enjoy the sunny weather?
column2: 還是說你喜歡烈日炎炎的夏天呢？

column1: I consider the bees and butterflies to be my special friends!
column2: 我把蜜蜂和蝴蝶都當作是我的好朋友！

column1: If I wasn't so busy I'd come help you on the farm!
column2: 如果我有空我會去農場幫你的！

column1: But Gus would be upset if I had another job...
column2: 不過如果我有別的工作格斯會不高興的……

column1: You know, I'm sure Gus would understand if I wanted to leave the Saloon someday.
column2: 如果有一天我想離開酒吧，我相信格斯會理解的。

column1: There's so much out there, I can't stay a barmaid forever.
column2: 有這麼多機會，我不能永遠做一個酒吧女服務生。

column1: Don't overwork yourself or you might end up in Harvey's clinic!
column2: 不要太勉強自己了，不然可能會被送進哈維的診所哦！

column1: Hi @!
It's around this time of year that my good friends visit the region... I mean the parrots!
column2: 每年一到這個時候，我的好朋友就會過來……我說的是鸚鵡哦！

column1: Well, fall is here. Time to plant some new crops, huh?
column2: 好啦，已經到秋天。該種些新的作物吧？

column1: It's good weather for a picnic, isn't it?
column2: 這是個野餐的好季節，對不對？

column1: If I didn't have to work I'd suggest we go on a nice picnic!
column2: 如果我沒有工作的話我一定會提議去野餐的！

column1: Hello. Did you have a good summer?
column2: 你好啊。這個夏天過得怎麼樣？

column1: Hi @! I bet your farm did great this past summer, huh?
column2: 嗨，@！這個夏天，你的農場經營得不錯吧？

column1: You're an excellent farmer.
column2: 你真是個出色的農夫。

column1: My friend runs a shop in the desert. If you ever go there stop in and say hi for me.
column2: 我的朋友在沙漠裡開了個商店。如果你有機會去的話替我問個好。

column1: I think she sells some rare products.
column2: 她好像是在賣一些稀有的商品。

column1: Are you friends with Clint? He's a nice guy, if you get to know him.
column2: 你們是克林特的朋友嗎？認識他以後你就會發現，他是個好人。

column1: He gets lonely working in his shop all day. But he's so shy he has trouble making new friends.
column2: 他整天都悶在商店裡工作，所以感覺很孤獨。不過他很害羞，導致他交朋友有些困難。

column1: I think Clint's mad at me. He never looks at me anymore...
column2: 克林特好像在生我的氣。他再也不來看我了……

column1: I always thought we were friends.
column2: 我還一直以為我們是朋友。

column1: Another beautiful fall day.
column2: 又是個秋高氣爽的好日子。

column1: It's a pity it'll soon be over.
column2: 想想這樣的日子馬上就要結束了還真是遺憾啊。

column1: Smell that clean air? It's lovely, isn't it?
column2: 呼吸到這清新的空氣了嗎？是不是很棒？

column1: I just fear that the Joja Co.'s of the world will take this away from us.
column2: 我就害怕 Joja 公司會毀掉這新鮮的空氣。

column1: Keep your mind open and some interesting things might take root.
column2: 想開一點，有趣的事情可能就會發生哦。

column1: Anyway, how is your day going?
column2: 對了，今天過得怎麼樣？

column1: I don't have any huge plans for life. I prefer not to stress about the future.
column2: 我沒什麼遠大的計畫。我也不想因思考未來變得緊張兮兮的。

column1: Nothing like a sunny sunday to lift the spirits!
column2: 陽光明媚的日子果然能讓人振作啊！

column1: There's so many invisible barriers holding us back. Why can't people learn to let go and celebrate freedom?
column2: 有很多無形的壁壘阻礙了我們前進的步伐。為什麼人們不能學會放下包袱、迎接自由呢？

column1: Me? Well, you know what they say... 'You can't cage a wild Junimo'.
column2: 我嗎？你知道他們是怎麼說的嗎……「你無法將野生的祝尼魔關進籠子裡」。

column1: You're such a nice person, @! Thanks for being my friend.
column2: 你真是個好人，@！謝謝你成為我的朋友。

column1: Be careful an icicle doesn't fall on your head!
column2: 小心別讓冰柱砸到腦袋！

column1: Be careful an icicle doesn't fall on your head! I wouldn't want you to get hurt!
column2: 小心別讓冰柱砸到腦袋！我可不想讓我最好的朋友受傷！

column1: Oh, hello @!
column2: 哦，你好啊，@！

column1: You must be getting very good at farming by now, huh?
column2: 你現在是不是很擅長種植了？

column1: I bet you're an excellent farmer by now!
column2: 我覺得你現在肯定是個了不起的農夫了！

column1: I think my hair is frozen solid...
column2: 我的頭髮好像結冰了……

column1: Haley and I aren't made for such a big house. It's a hassle to keep it clean.
column2: 海莉和我生來就沒有住大房子的命。打掃大房子真是太難了。

column1: Ah well. I really shouldn't be complaining.
column2: 啊，我不該這麼抱怨。

column1: Your farmhouse seems nice and cozy.
column2: 你的農舍看起來真是溫馨又舒適啊。

column1: It must be so cold for the poor fish.
column2: 這些可憐的魚一定覺得很冷吧。

column1: I wonder if any fish hibernate? Maybe I should ask Demetrius.
column2: 不知道魚會不會冬眠啊？也許我可以去問迪馬崔斯。

column1: If I wasn't so busy I'd help you dig around in that cave by the lake.
column2: 如果我有空，我挺想幫你在湖邊的那個洞裡翻一翻的。

column1: I bet there are some powerful crystals inside there.
column2: 裡面一定有一些強大的水晶。

column1: Do you know how to cook 'Bean Hotpot'?
column2: 你會做「豆類火鍋」嗎？

column1: I like that dish quite a bit.
column2: 我很喜歡那道菜。

column1: It's hard to get fresh ingredients in the winter, huh?
column2: 不過在冬天想要獲得新鮮的食材很難啊，是不是？

column1: Hi!
column2: 嗨！

column1: ...Yes?
column2: ……有事嗎？

column1: My sister and I might fight sometimes, but I would really miss her if she left.
column2: 我和我妹有時候會吵架，不過要是她真的離開了，我會非常想她的。

column1: I think she'll become a very nice young lady some day... Don't tell her I said that.
column2: 我覺得她總有一天會成為一名善良的女性……別讓她知道是我說的哦。

column1: So, is there anything you want to talk about?
column2: 所以說，你想聊些什麼嗎？

column1: Say hi to my sister for me! And remind her to visit me tomorrow.
column2: 代我向我妹妹問好！還有，提醒她明天來看我。
